summaryText: Wow, what a powerful message from Pastor Travis Hearn about navigating life's storms! In this incredible sermon from the 'Jesus Over Giants' series, Pastor Travis uses the dramatic shipwreck story of Paul in Acts 27 to teach us how to survive and thrive during life's most challenging moments. Isn't it amazing how God can use even a shipwreck to demonstrate His incredible power and provision? Pastor Travis breaks down five key strategies for surviving life's storms: focus on God's voice, remember you belong to God, sail with the right people, cut harmful anchors, and keep holding on. The most powerful moment? When he reminds us that sometimes God's blessings come through our brokenness - those planks and debris aren't just remnants of destruction, they're actually God's provision! I love how Pastor Travis constantly points us back to Jesus, showing that no matter how fierce the storm, Jesus is always with us. The sermon is a powerful reminder that we're not defined by our circumstances, but by whose we are - we are God's precious children, and He will see us through every single storm.
mainPoints: God speaks to us even in the midst of life's storms
Your identity is found in belonging to God, not your circumstances
Sometimes God's greatest blessings come through our brokenness

versesMentioned.text: Last night an angel of the God to whom I belong and whom I serve stood beside me
You were bought at a price. Therefore honor God with your bodies.

Who shall separate us from the love of Christ? Shall trouble or hardship or persecution or famine or nakedness or danger or sword? No, in all these things we are more than conquerors through him who loved us. For I am convinced that neither death nor life, neither angels nor demons, neither the present nor the future, nor any powers, neither height nor depth, nor anything else in all creation, will be able to separate us from the love of God that is in Christ Jesus our Lord.

Therefore, since we are surrounded by such a great cloud of witnesses, let us throw off everything that hinders and the sin that so easily entangles. And let us run with perseverance the race marked out for us, fixing our eyes on Jesus, the pioneer and perfecter of faith.

The word that came to Jeremiah from the Lord: 'Go down to the potter's house, and there I will give you my message.' So I went down to the potter's house, and I saw him working at the wheel. But the pot he was shaping from the clay was marred in his hands; so the potter formed it into another pot, shaping it as seemed best to him.
For God so loved the world that he gave his one and only Son, that whoever believes in him shall not perish but have eternal life.
If you declare with your mouth, 'Jesus is Lord,' and believe in your heart that God raised him from the dead, you will be saved.

Monday.scripture: Psalm 46:1: 'God is our refuge and strength, an ever-present help in trouble.'
Monday.focus: Recognizing God's presence in our storms
Monday.action: Write down a current challenge you're facing. Spend time reflecting on how God might be present in this situation, even if you can't see it clearly.
Monday.prayer: Lord, help me trust Your presence in my current storm. Give me eyes to see Your work, even when circumstances feel overwhelming. Remind me that You are my refuge and strength. Amen.

Tuesday.scripture: Isaiah 43:2: 'When you pass through the waters, I will be with you; and when you pass through the rivers, they will not sweep over you.'
Tuesday.action: Make a list of past challenges you've overcome. Reflect on how God was with you during those times and how those experiences have strengthened your faith.
Tuesday.prayer: Heavenly Father, thank You for Your constant protection. Help me remember Your faithfulness in past storms and trust You in my current challenges. Strengthen my faith today. Amen.

Wednesday.scripture: James 1:2-4: 'Consider it pure joy, my brothers and sisters, whenever you face trials of many kinds, because you know that the testing of your faith produces perseverance.'
Wednesday.action: Identify one area of personal growth that has come through a difficult season. Journal about how that challenge ultimately made you stronger and more dependent on God.
Wednesday.prayer: God, help me view my challenges as opportunities for spiritual growth. Transform my perspective from seeing trials as obstacles to seeing them as chances to develop spiritual strength. Amen.

Thursday.scripture: Proverbs 3:5-6: 'Trust in the Lord with all your heart and lean not on your own understanding; in all your ways submit to him, and he will make your paths straight.'
Thursday.action: Practice intentional surrender today. When you feel anxious or want to control a situation, pause and pray, asking God to guide your steps.
Thursday.prayer: Lord, I surrender my need for control. Help me trust You completely, even when I can't see the way forward. Guide my steps and give me Your peace. Amen.

Friday.scripture: Romans 8:28: 'And we know that in all things God works for the good of those who love him, who have been called according to his purpose.'
Friday.action: Create a 'God's Goodness' list. Write down ways God has unexpectedly worked things out for your good in past challenges.
Friday.prayer: Faithful God, help me trust Your plan, even when I don't understand. Remind me that You are always working, even in the midst of my storms. Give me faith to believe in Your ultimate goodness. Amen.

Saturday.scripture: Philippians 4:13: 'I can do all this through him who gives me strength.'
Saturday.action: Reflect on a current challenge that feels overwhelming. Spend time in prayer, specifically asking God to be your strength in that area.
Saturday.prayer: Jesus, I cannot overcome this challenge in my own strength. Fill me with Your power, Your courage, and Your hope. Be my strength today and always. Amen.
